For other versions see [Immortal (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)](/starcraft2/Immortal_(Wings_of_Liberty_and_Heart_of_the_Swarm) "Immortal (Wings of Liberty and Heart of the Swarm)") and [Immortal (Legacy of the Void Campaign)](/starcraft2/Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void_Campaign) "Immortal (Legacy of the Void Campaign)") ._ \[[e](https://liquipedia.net/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_%28Legacy_of_the_Void%29&action=edit§ion=0)\ \]\[[h](/starcraft2/Template:Infobox_unit "Template:Infobox unit")\ \]![Protoss](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/0/0f/Protoss_race_icon.png/30px-Protoss_race_icon.png%20%22Protoss%22)¬†Immortal [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/ee/SC2Immortal.jpg/600px-SC2Immortal.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Immortal.jpg) [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/ee/SC2Immortal.jpg/600px-SC2Immortal.jpg)](/starcraft2/File:SC2Immortal.jpg) Unit Information Type: Ground Unit Description: Assault strider. Can use Barrier to absorb damage. Built From: [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") Cost: [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") ¬†275¬†[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/2/2e/Vespene-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") ¬†100¬†[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Buildtime_protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed") ¬†39¬†[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") ¬†4 [Hotkey](/starcraft2/Hotkeys_per_Race "Hotkeys per Race") : I Attack 1: Phase Disruptors Targets: Ground Damage: 20 (+2) [DPS](/starcraft2/Damage_Per_Second "Damage Per Second") : 19.2 (+1.92) [Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown") : 1.04 Bonus: +30 (+3) vs [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") Bonus DPS: +28.9 (+2.9) vs [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") [Range](/starcraft2/Range "Range") : 6 Unit stats Defense: ![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/e/e2/Icon_Hitpoints.png) 200 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/82/Icon_Shields.png)](/starcraft2/Plasma_Shield "Plasma Shield") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/5/5e/Icon_Armor.png)](/starcraft2/Armor "Armor") 1 (+1) Attributes: [Armored](/starcraft2/Armored "Armored") , [Mechanical](/starcraft2/Mechanical "Mechanical") Sight: 9 Speed: 3.15 Cargo size: 4 Strong against: * [Siege Tank](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") * [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") * [Roach](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") Weak against: * [Marine](/starcraft2/Marine "Marine") * [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") * [Zergling](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") Contents -------- * [1 Description](#Description) * [2 Abilities](#Abilities) * [3 Competitive Usage](#Competitive_Usage) * [3.1 General](#General) * [3.2 Vs. Protoss](#Vs._Protoss) * [3.3 Vs. Terran](#Vs._Terran) * [3.4 Vs. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [4 Gallery](#Gallery) * [5 Quotes](#Quotes) * [6 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [7 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Immortal** is a durable ranged, mechanized strider for the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") army, produced at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") . Their [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") ability makes them specialists at taking damage. Additionally, they have a powerful anti-armour attack making them capable against high-power units such as [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") . Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/cc/Barrier.png/62px-Barrier.png)](/starcraft2/File:Barrier.png) | **Caster:** Immortal

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 32 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 2 s

Absorbs up to 100 damage while blocking the first instance of damage. Lasts for 2 seconds. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: General")\ \] The Immortal has succeeded the [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") as the premier Anchor unit of the Robotics Facility since the release of Legacy of the Void, due to a variety of reasons. For the Immortal's part, the reworked Barrier ability made them durable against a far wider variety of attacks. Immortals relate well to other Protoss units. [Warp Prisms](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") can now help move Immortals safely in and out of range to devastating effect, as used by [HerO](/starcraft2/HerO "HerO") in tournaments - against [Life](/starcraft2/Life "Life") in the [IPL Tournament of Champions](/starcraft2/IPL_Tournament_of_Champions "IPL Tournament of Champions") and against [Jaedong](/starcraft2/Jaedong "Jaedong") at [IEM Season VIII - Cologne](/starcraft2/IEM_Season_VIII_-_Cologne "IEM Season VIII - Cologne") , one of his Immortals recorded over 40 kills. Compared to the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , Immortals now have the same DPS per cost against non-armored units ([![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") 275 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") 4 vs [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") 250 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") 4 for two Stalkers, with both providing about 19 DPS). The choice between the two is determined by a trade-off between Immortal's larger anti-armor bonus and the Stalker's anti-air and mobility capabilities ([Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") and remote warp-in). In small numbers, Immortals are particularly effective support against [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") as armored units during the early game. Even so, larger numbers of Immortals are highly useful against higher-tech armored units into the late game, especially key targets like burrowed [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") or [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Immortals deal a large amount of damage to [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossi "Colossi") , but are quite ineffective against enemy [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") . [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") /Immortal vs [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") /[Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossi "Colossi") battles generally revolve around the Immortal user trying to snipe the opponent's [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") before they are able to do too much damage. However, if [Extended Thermal Lances](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lances "Extended Thermal Lances") is researched, the player with 9-range Colossi retains a large range advantage over the 6-range Immortals and often can position his Colossi to avoid Immortal fire while still attacking. Against Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Stalker, however with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Immortals are incredibly effective against small numbers of sieged [Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") due to their slow rate of fire, and do quite well against other armored units such as [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") . Like when fighting Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Siege Tank; with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3. Immortals are also effective against [Thors](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") , having similar effective HP but much more attack per supply. Two Immortals in a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") may be dropped into a Terran base to destroy SCVs. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] The use of early Immortals depends on the Zerg's strategy. They are less effective against [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") and [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") and are unable to attack [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") , and thus have little use against Zerg armies that largely consist of these units. Conversely, Immortals are strongly cost-effective against [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") due to their 50 base damage against armored units and +2 range advantage over Roaches. Do note that just because Immortals counter Roaches does not mean that it's black and white, as their economic costs and production system are very different. [GAMETIME](/starcraft2/GAMETIME "GAMETIME") a 6k MMR Zerg player has been known to take wins against Protoss players with mass Roach timings, meaning when they hit early enough, Immortals alone aren't enough. [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") are excellent additions when defending these timings as forcefields can deny Roaches the ability to walk up to the Immortal and attack. Towards the midgame, Immortals are not a unit a Protoss player should avoid. Even if the opponent starts without any Roaches or [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , producing Immortals preemptively denies the transition for the Zerg player due to their bonus against armor, which is particuarly important in protecting the Protoss from a Lurker switch. For example, Hydralisk-based armies tend to transition into Lurkers making the Immortal necessary. Keep in mind that they also shut down [Ultralisk](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") transitions, which are another example of an armored unit. Zerg](#Vs._Zerg) * [4 Gallery](#Gallery) * [5 Quotes](#Quotes) * [6 Patch Changes](#Patch_Changes) * [7 References](#References) Description\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=1 "Edit section: Description")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- The **Immortal** is a durable ranged, mechanized strider for the [Protoss](/starcraft2/Protoss "Protoss") army, produced at the [Robotics Facility](/starcraft2/Robotics_Facility "Robotics Facility") . Their [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") ability makes them specialists at taking damage. Additionally, they have a powerful anti-armour attack making them capable against high-power units such as [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") and [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") . Abilities\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=2 "Edit section: Abilities")\ \] ------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- [Barrier](/starcraft2/Barrier "Barrier") | | | | --- | --- | | [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/c/cc/Barrier.png/62px-Barrier.png)](/starcraft2/File:Barrier.png) | **Caster:** Immortal

**[Cooldown](/starcraft2/Cooldown "Cooldown")
:** 32 s

**[Duration](/starcraft2/Game_Speed "Game Speed")
:** 2 s

Absorbs up to 100 damage while blocking the first instance of damage. Lasts for 2 seconds. | Competitive Usage\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=3 "Edit section: Competitive Usage")\ \] ----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- ### General\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=4 "Edit section: General")\ \] The Immortal has succeeded the [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") as the premier Anchor unit of the Robotics Facility since the release of Legacy of the Void, due to a variety of reasons. For the Immortal's part, the reworked Barrier ability made them durable against a far wider variety of attacks. Immortals relate well to other Protoss units. [Warp Prisms](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") can now help move Immortals safely in and out of range to devastating effect, as used by [HerO](/starcraft2/HerO "HerO") in tournaments - against [Life](/starcraft2/Life "Life") in the [IPL Tournament of Champions](/starcraft2/IPL_Tournament_of_Champions "IPL Tournament of Champions") and against [Jaedong](/starcraft2/Jaedong "Jaedong") at [IEM Season VIII - Cologne](/starcraft2/IEM_Season_VIII_-_Cologne "IEM Season VIII - Cologne") , one of his Immortals recorded over 40 kills. Compared to the [Stalker](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , Immortals now have the same DPS per cost against non-armored units ([![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") 275 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") 4 vs [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/a/a4/Minerals.gif)](/starcraft2/Minerals "Minerals") 250 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/8c/Vespene-terran.gif)](/starcraft2/Gas "Gas") 100 [![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/8/86/Supply-protoss.gif)](/starcraft2/Supply "Supply") 4 for two Stalkers, with both providing about 19 DPS). The choice between the two is determined by a trade-off between Immortal's larger anti-armor bonus and the Stalker's anti-air and mobility capabilities ([Blink](/starcraft2/Blink "Blink") and remote warp-in). In small numbers, Immortals are particularly effective support against [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") , [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") and [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") as armored units during the early game. Even so, larger numbers of Immortals are highly useful against higher-tech armored units into the late game, especially key targets like burrowed [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") or [Siege Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") . ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/e/e4/ProtossIcon.png/30px-ProtossIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ProtossIcon.png) Protoss\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=5 "Edit section: Vs. Protoss")\ \] Immortals deal a large amount of damage to [Stalkers](/starcraft2/Stalker "Stalker") and [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossi "Colossi") , but are quite ineffective against enemy [Zealots](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") . [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") /Immortal vs [Zealot](/starcraft2/Zealot "Zealot") /[Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossi "Colossi") battles generally revolve around the Immortal user trying to snipe the opponent's [Colossi](/starcraft2/Colossus "Colossus") before they are able to do too much damage. However, if [Extended Thermal Lances](/starcraft2/Extended_Thermal_Lances "Extended Thermal Lances") is researched, the player with 9-range Colossi retains a large range advantage over the 6-range Immortals and often can position his Colossi to avoid Immortal fire while still attacking. Against Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Stalker, however with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/9/94/TerranIcon.png/30px-TerranIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:TerranIcon.png) Terran\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=6 "Edit section: Vs. Terran")\ \] Immortals are incredibly effective against small numbers of sieged [Tanks](/starcraft2/Siege_Tank "Siege Tank") due to their slow rate of fire, and do quite well against other armored units such as [Marauders](/starcraft2/Marauder "Marauder") . Like when fighting Stalkers, an un-upgraded Immortal will take 4 shots to kill a Siege Tank; with +1 Weapons, an Immortal needs only 3. Immortals are also effective against [Thors](/starcraft2/Thor "Thor") , having similar effective HP but much more attack per supply. Two Immortals in a [Warp Prism](/starcraft2/Warp_Prism "Warp Prism") may be dropped into a Terran base to destroy SCVs. ### Vs.[![](https://liquipedia.net/commons/images/thumb/d/d1/ZergIcon.png/30px-ZergIcon.png)](/starcraft2/File:ZergIcon.png) Zerg\[[edit](/starcraft2/index.php?title=Immortal_(Legacy_of_the_Void)&action=edit§ion=7 "Edit section: Vs. Zerg")\ \] The use of early Immortals depends on the Zerg's strategy. They are less effective against [Hydralisks](/starcraft2/Hydralisk "Hydralisk") and [Zerglings](/starcraft2/Zergling "Zergling") and are unable to attack [Mutalisks](/starcraft2/Mutalisk "Mutalisk") , and thus have little use against Zerg armies that largely consist of these units. Conversely, Immortals are strongly cost-effective against [Roaches](/starcraft2/Roach "Roach") due to their 50 base damage against armored units and +2 range advantage over Roaches. Do note that just because Immortals counter Roaches does not mean that it's black and white, as their economic costs and production system are very different. [GAMETIME](/starcraft2/GAMETIME "GAMETIME") a 6k MMR Zerg player has been known to take wins against Protoss players with mass Roach timings, meaning when they hit early enough, Immortals alone aren't enough. [Sentries](/starcraft2/Sentry "Sentry") are excellent additions when defending these timings as forcefields can deny Roaches the ability to walk up to the Immortal and attack. Towards the midgame, Immortals are not a unit a Protoss player should avoid. Even if the opponent starts without any Roaches or [Lurkers](/starcraft2/Lurker "Lurker") , producing Immortals preemptively denies the transition for the Zerg player due to their bonus against armor, which is particuarly important in protecting the Protoss from a Lurker switch. For example, Hydralisk-based armies tend to transition into Lurkers making the Immortal necessary. Keep in mind that they also shut down [Ultralisk](/starcraft2/Ultralisk "Ultralisk") transitions, which are another example of an armored unit.
